FuncDef:
The peer next-hop-local command configures a BGP MVPN device to set its IP address as the next hop of routes when advertising the routes to an IBGP peer group.
The undo peer next-hop-local command restores the default configuration. The peer next-hop-local command configures a BGP MVPN device to set its IP address as the next hop of routes when advertising the routes to an IBGP peer group. The undo peer next-hop-local command restores the default configuration. By default:

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a BGP peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters and cannot contain spaces. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

Configures the device to set its IP address as the next hop of routes when the device advertises the routes to an IBGP peer or peer group in RR scenarios.
